site_name: 229-255 And 277-279 Kingston Road  New MaldenKT3 3SW
description: Non-Material Amendment to vary the wording of Conditions 5 (Drainage), 8 (Post Remediation), 27 (Secure Cycle Parking), 29 (Refuse Storage), 48 (Window Openings) 49 (Sound Insulation Measures) and 50 (Mechanical Ventilation and Heat Recovery systems) of Planning Permission ref: 19/01228/FUl ((Redevelopment of the site to provide 297 residential units in buildings ranging from 4 to 7 storeys, with 207 sq m commercial space (A1, A2, A3, A4, B1 and D1) at ground floor, 123 car parking spaces (including car club and accessible provision); communal landscaped amenity areas, secure cycle parking, stopping up of Avenue Terrace and other associated development). Please refer to cover letter for proposed amendments

decision_conditions: Existing Condition 5 which states: Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted and had  approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a final detailed drainage design which accommodates the existing surface water outfall from Lawson Builders Yard. The detailed design shall include supporting calculations and an updated Drainage Assessment. The detailed design shall be aligned with the Sept 2019 Former Homebase Site, Kingston Road, New Malden Foul, Surface Water / SUDs Strategy Ref No: IDL/940/DS/01, Issue 3 and associated drawings.  The detailed design shall show the size of all drainage features, including green roofs, permeable paving and rainwater harvesting and include detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to occupation of the development hereby permitted.  No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to London Plan Policy 5.13, its associated Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems and Kingston Council's Local Plan Policy DM4. Is replaced by:  5. a) The drainage design shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved via application 20/01698/CLC and shall align with the Sept 2019 Former Homebase Site, Kingston Road, New Malden Foul, Surface Water / SUDs Strategy Ref No: IDL/940/DS/01, Issue 3 and associated drawings.  Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to London Plan Policy 5.13, its associated Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems and Kingston Council's Local Plan Policy DM4. 5. b) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core A as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. c) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core B as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. d) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core C as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. e) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core D as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. f) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core E as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. g) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core F as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. h) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core G as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. i) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core H as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. 5. j) Prior to the occupation of any part of Core J as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to London Plan Policy Policy SI 12, its associated Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems and Kingston Council's Local Plan Policy DM4. Existing Condition 8 which states:  On completion of the agreed remediation works and prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and is subject to the approval in writing by the Local Authority. Reason: To prevent harm to human health and pollution of the environment in accordance with the aims and objectives of the borough's Local Plan.To ensure that the risks from land contamination is understood prior to works on site both during the construction phase and on completion and to ensure that the risks to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised. Is replaced by:  8. a) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core A, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority. 8.b) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core B, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority.  8.c) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core C, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority.  8.d) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core D, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority.  8.e) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core E, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority.  8.f) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core F, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority. 8.g) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core G, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority. 8.h) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core H, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority. 8.i) On completion of approved remediation works and prior to the first occupation of any part of Core J, as referenced on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021, a verification report including quality assurance certificates that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted within 28 days of the report being completed and approved in writing by the Local Authority. Reason: To prevent harm to human health and pollution of the environment in accordance with the aims and objectives of the borough's Local Plan.To ensure that the risks from land contamination is understood prior to works on site both during the construction phase and on completion and to ensure that the risks to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised. Existing Condition 27 which states :  Before the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved, details of secure cycle parking facilities for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development, shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Is replaced by:Secure cycle parking facilities for the occupants of, and visitors to the development shall be provided prior to the occupation of each Core (as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan date June 2021) of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Existing Condition 29 which states: Refuse storage facilities and recycling facilities shall be provided prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such facilities to be permanently retained at the site. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development shall either be stored within this dedicated store/area as shown on the approved plans, or internally within the building(s) that form part of the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material shall be stored or placed for collection on the public highway or pavement, except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Is replaced by: Refuse storage facilities and recycling facilities shall be provided prior to the occupation of each Core (as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan date June 2021) of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such facilities are to be permanently retained at the site. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development shall either be stored within this dedicated store/area as shown on the approved plans, or internally within the building(s) that form part of the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material shall be stored or placed for collection on the public highway or pavement, except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Existing Condition 48 which states: No building shall be occupied until details of fixed windows/openings as shown on the following plans have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning authority:  D6701rev05SW - Elevation Sealed Window Locations D6101rev04SW - First Floor Sealed Window Locations D6102rev04SW - Second Floor Sealed Window Locations D6103rev04SW - Third Floor Sealed Window Locations D6104rev04SW - Fourth Floor Sealed Window Locations D6105rev04SW - Fifth Floor Sealed Window Locations D6106rev04SW - Sixth Floor Sealed Window LocationsThe development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the units affected and retained for the lifetime of  the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing. Reasons: to safeguard the amenity of future occupiers and to remove the risk of noise complaints against adjoining noise generating uses, in accordance with 'Agent of Change' principles. Is replaced by:The affected units shall not be occupied until details of fixed windows/openings as shown on the following plans have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning authority:D6701rev05SW - Elevation Sealed Window LocationsD6101rev04SW - First Floor Sealed Window LocationsD6102rev04SW - Second Floor Sealed Window LocationsD6103rev04SW - Third Floor Sealed Window LocationsD6104rev04SW - Fourth Floor Sealed Window LocationsD6105rev04SW - Fifth Floor Sealed Window LocationsD6106rev04SW - Sixth Floor Sealed Window LocationsThe development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the units affected and retained for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writingReasons: to safeguard the amenity of future occupiers and to remove the risk of noise complaints against adjoining noise generating uses, in accordance with 'Agent of Change' principles. Existing Condition 49 which states: Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted, full details of sound insulation measures (inclusive of facade treatment and glazing) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and provided before first occupation of the development hereby permitted and thereafter retained.Reason: in order to protect the amenity of future occupiers and to minimise risk of noise complaint to existing adjoining business in accordance with paragraph 182 of the NPPF 2019 and Policy D13 and D14 of draft London Plan. Is replaced by: Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted, full details of sound insulation measures (inclusive of facade treatment and glazing) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and provided prior to the first occupation of each Core (as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021) of the development hereby permitted and thereafter retained.Reason: in order to protect the amenity of future occupiers and to minimise risk of noise complaint to existing adjoining business in accordance with paragraph 182 of the NPPF 2019 and Policy D13 and D14 of the London Plan 2021.Existing Condition 50 which states: Prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted, full details of mechanical ventilation and heat recovery systems to be installed shall have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details before first occupation and thereafter retained. Reason: to safeguard the amenity of future occupiersIs replaced by:  Prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted, full details of mechanical ventilation and heat recovery systems to be installed shall have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details before first occupation of each Core (as shown on the Construction Phasing Plan dated June 2021) and thereafter retained.Reason: to safeguard the amenity of future occupiers
